Articles.Content:
Here's a mobile lander/rover I've put together

Here's my (non stackable) first prototype, after climbing a 45Ã‚Â° slope

And leaving the Mun after staging

It costs some 38700 funds

It works as a rover, it has a full scientific equipment loadout (well, except for the atmospheric cones), a bit less of 2700 m/s of delta-v, a probe core to fly it unmanned and the docking ports can be used to stack them over each other, so you can send a single ship with three or four of those things. They weight some 12 tons, so they shouldn't be too hard to deliver to their destination.

There is a small monopropellant tank between the lander can and the lower docking port. The structural panels help protect the FT-400 fuel tanks - they can be removed to get some additional delta-v, at the risk of blowing one of the tanks while moving around and getting stranded.

The action groups are set as 1 to toggle the solar panels and 2 to toggle all the ladders. Regarding ladders, your kerbonaut will be stuck trying to move down the ladder from the landing can, but you can let go of the ladder without the risk of destroying the engine below. Climbing the ladder works without any issue.

The first set of decouplers jettison the wheels, making the craft lighter for ascend. The second set jettisons the fuel tanks, goo and material labs, so make sure you collect all the science from them before staging.

Download as a subassembly

https://mega.co.nz/#!4VcnCTqY!npSZzXIQbU9GlVbVNnNl5v6UHZEFFitxHpIqYUEf27A

And as a ship

https://mega.co.nz/#!BBkgVaBQ!aDe1l-IvQwy5LeeciLkkC2yrmu4BIkl_7YQiVByQNV8

Here I have four of them stacked on top of a booster

You do need lots of struts, though

But with moar struts, it can be done

Looks like a lot of work went into this man, +rep for you,

I will have to try them out, i do not have a good system of transporting rovers atm (Not a massive fan of rockets lol)

Thanks! It's really the result of a lot of gameplay and failed or not entirely successful attempts to pack several landers in a single ship. They are still somewhat hard to put in orbit due wobbling - they really have to be attached with lots of struts, and the booster I've used should have used more powerful reaction wheels. But it's doable.

As for packing them in SSTOs, no idea. I didn't build them for that. Maybe they can be mounted in one of B9 large cargo bays or a custom made one.

Then there is the matter of a mission profile for this. The exploration of Jool smaller moons seems an obvious one. They can also be used to hit biomes in the Mun or Minmus in a single launch, but they require some later technology. The wheels can be replaced by the earlier model in that case I guess. They can also be useful for Fine Print rover contracts: put them in orbit and keep dropping them near the nav points, doing science on the way.

Landing in a rover also allows a bit more activity than "landing, planting the flag, doing experiments and going back" as it's easier to add a "drive around" to the mix.

Now I'm wondering if they could take off from Duna. Maybe that would require replacing the 48-7s for aerospikes, adding more parachutes and maybe a few drop tanks.
